Class ClientReceive

  • java.lang.Object
    • ClientReceive

  • public class ClientReceive
extends java.lang.Object
    ClientReceive contains methods that handle messages from the server, corresponding to user operations.

    Handles server messages after processing user operations including:

    • Delete Account
    • Send Message
    • Check Inbox
    • List Users
    • End Session

        public ClientReceive()

    • Method Detail

      • createAccountSuccess

        public static void createAccountSuccess(java.net.Socket conn,
                                        byte[] buffer)
        Prints a create account success message to the client. Takes in Socket conn and byte [] buffer, which contains the username of the created account.

      • createAccountFailure

        public static void createAccountFailure(java.net.Socket conn,
                                        byte[] buffer)
        Prints a create account failure message to the client. Takes in Socket conn and byte [] buffer, which contains the reason that the account was not created successfully.

      • loginSuccess

        public static void loginSuccess(java.net.Socket conn,
                                byte[] buffer)
        Prints a log in success message to the client. Takes in Socket conn and byte [] buffer, which contains the username of the created account and whether the user has any unread messages according to the server. The server updates the status of unread messages for each user, and if the user logging in has any, they are greeted with a message to check their inbox for the unread messages sent while they were offline.

      • loginFailure

        public static void loginFailure(java.net.Socket conn,
                                byte[] buffer)
        Prints a log ins failure message to the client. Takes in Socket conn and byte [] buffer, which contains the reason that the account was not created successfully.

      • listAllAccountsSuccess

        public static void listAllAccountsSuccess(java.net.Socket conn,
                                          byte[] buffer)
        Prints a list all accounts success message to the client. Takes in Socket conn and byte [] buffer, which contains the queried list of users. The list is then printed to screen.

      • sendMessageSuccess

        public static void sendMessageSuccess(java.net.Socket conn,
                                      byte[] buffer)
        Prints a send message success message to the client. Takes in Socket conn and byte [] buffer. Simply prints that the message was successfully sent.

      • pullAllMessagesSuccess

        public static void pullAllMessagesSuccess(java.net.Socket conn,
                                          byte[] buffer)
        Prints a pull all messages success message to the client. Takes in Socket conn and byte [] buffer, which contains all of the messages in the inbox of the user. Prints all messages to screen, separated by whitespace.

      • pushMessageSuccess

        public static void pushMessageSuccess(java.net.Socket conn,
                                      byte[] buffer)
        Prints a push message success message to the client, alerting the user that they have received a new message. Takes in Socket conn and byte [] buffer, which contains the username of the message sender.

      • deleteAccountSuccess

        public static void deleteAccountSuccess(java.net.Socket conn,
                                        byte[] buffer)
        Prints a delete account success message to the client. Takes in Socket conn and byte [] buffer, which contains the username of the deleted account.

      • generalFailure

        public static void generalFailure(java.net.Socket conn,
                                  byte[] buffer)
        Prints a general failure message to the client, to communicate to the user that the prior action was not completed successfully. Takes in Socket conn and byte [] buffer, which contains the reason that the account was not created successfully.
